brief_summary.textblock:
This study will identify the highest dose, and assess the safety, of PRT062070 that may be
      given in patients with relapsed/refractory chronic lymphocytic leukemia or non-hodgkin
      lymphoma

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 1 Dose Escalation Study in Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia and Non-hodgkin Lymphoma

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient must have a diagnosis of CLL/SLL or B-cell Non-Hodgkin lymphoma (diffuse
             large B-cell lymphoma [DLBCL], follicular lymphoma [FL], mantle cell lymphoma [MCL],
             MALT lymphoma, marginal zone lymphoma [MZ], lymphoplasmacytic lymphoma)

          -  Patient must be 18 years or older, of either sex, and of any race.

          -  Diagnosis of CLL/SLL or B-cell Non-Hodgkin lymphoma (diffuse large B-cell lymphoma
             [DLBCL], follicular lymphoma [FL], mantle cell lymphoma [MCL], MALT lymphoma,
             marginal zone lymphoma [MZ], lymphoplasmacytic lymphoma)

          -  Progression on at least one prior treatment regimen and no standard therapy exists

          -  ECOG Performance Score of 0 or 1.

          -  18 years or older, of either sex, and of any race.

          -  Adequate hematologic, renal and hepatic function

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Prior allogeneic stem cell transplant

          -  Known lymphomatous involvement of the central nervous system (CNS).

          -  Investigational therapy within 30 days or 5 half-lives

          -  Known HIV, hepatitis B or hepatitis C infection or is known to be a carrier of
             hepatitis B or C.

          -  Receiving systemic steroids at doses greater than the equivalent of prednisone, 20 mg
             daily

          -  Female and is breast-feeding, pregnant or intends to become pregnant.

facility.name: Florida Cancer Specialists/Sarah Cannon Research Institute

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Open-Label, Multi-Dose, Dose Escalation Study Of PRT062070 In Patients With Relapsed/Refractory Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL)/Small Lymphocytic Lymphoma (SLL) Or B-Cell Non Hodgkin Lymphoma (NHL)

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of PRT062070 in patients with relapsed/refractory CLL, SLL or B-cell NHL.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 84 days (baseline to end of treatment)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and severity of dose limiting toxicity (as classified by Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAEv4) by dose level.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 114 days (baseline to 30 days post last treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak plasma concentration (Cmax) and area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) of PRT602070.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics/Dynamics Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
